Can't imagine many will come across this bug, but it's rendered Firefox 8 all but unusable for me.

Preparing to reproduce:

1.) Open the Profile Manager.
2.) Create a new profile.
3.) Save "window { margin: -1px !important; }" in <new profile folder>\chrome\userChrome.css.
4.) Launch Firefox with our new profile.
5.) Maximize window.
6.) Open the attached testcase.

Steps to reproduce (and resolve):

1.) Press Ctrl+- to zoom out one level; image brightens.
2.) Press Ctrl+0 to reset zoom; image reverts to normal.

-OR-

1.) Press Ctrl+- to zoom out one level; image brightens.
2.) Set gfx.direct2d.disabled to "true"; image reverts to normal.

Expected result: Zoom level shouldn't affect image brightness.

Actual result: Zoom level affects image brightness.

Bug present in Firefox 8 (beta 4 and onward, possibly prior), not present in Firefox 7 and below.
